meanings.definition: To select or designate someone for a specific role or duty.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was appointing a student as the class monitor.
meanings.sent2: The manager appointed a new team leader to oversee the project.
meanings.sent3: By appointing the cat as the official door greeter, the household had a furry welcome committee.
meanings.sent4: The sun appointing the moon as its emissary in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The king appointing his loyal knight to protect the kingdom.

meanings.definition: To schedule or set a time for a meeting or event.
meanings.sent1: She was appointing a meeting with the clients for next Monday.
meanings.sent2: The secretary appointed the conference call for 3 p.m.
meanings.sent3: Appointing a surprise party for the boss caught him completely off guard.
meanings.sent4: The clock appointing the hour for the long-awaited reunion.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock appointing the start of a new day.
